Write for Us

Have a story to tell about wedding planning, RSVPs, or the chaos of trying to get everyone’s addresses? We’d love to feature it.

The TextMyLink Wedding Blog is all about real stories and useful insight from couples, planners, and creators who’ve been through it. We share guidance, inspiration, and real celebrations that help people collect addresses, share updates, and bring every guest into their story with grace.

Why Write for Our Wedding Blog

Writing for TextMyLink is a chance to reach thousands of couples looking for honest, helpful advice — not another list of trends. Our readers want stories that sound real, not recycled. They want to know what actually works when planning a wedding, sending texts, or handling guests with less stress.

We accept:

  • Personal wedding stories and lessons learned
  • Tips on guest communication, RSVPs, and address collection
  • Smart ways to simplify wedding planning with texting tools or tech
  • Real wedding features with practical takeaways
  • Candid reflections from planners, vendors, or newlyweds

If you’re a writer, wedding planner, or newlywed with something to say, we’d love to feature your voice.

Submission Guidelines

  • Word Count: 600–900 words
  • Tone: Conversational, story-driven, and honest — write like you talk
  • Links: You may include relevant links
  • Originality: Submissions must be original and not published elsewhere
  • Formatting: Use clear headings and short paragraphs — we’ll handle the polish

Send your idea or draft to Daniel@textmylink.com with the subject line: Guest Post Submission – [Your Topic]

If your post is a fit, we’ll reply within two weeks with next steps.

Good Topics for Readers

Consider writing about:

  • How to collect wedding guest addresses easily
  • Wedding texting ideas for reminders and updates
  • RSVP tools and communication tips
  • Real wedding stories or behind-the-scenes advice
  • Stress-free wedding planning and guest management

Join Our Contributor Community

Whether you’re sharing your own wedding experience, offering expert planning advice, or spotlighting a creative idea that worked, we’d love to hear from you.

Submit your wedding story today and help other couples plan with a little more grace — and a lot less stress.
